reviews.review_msg: Super nice guy - really interesting. Hard class, hard marker.  WebCT notes never complete. Lots of confusion about expectation, what he was looking for, what he wanted for answers etc...

Very interesting material but horrible prof. He's a researcher not a teacher. On Webct he does not post the complete powerpoint lecture outlines. Very stressful to keep up in lecture. Talks too much on slides we already have (half an hour a slide!) and as little as 15 seconds on ones we don't have! Good mark or not, it will be stressful.

Too much material in too little time... Prof seems to jump all over the place. Unorganized powerpoint slides. Extremely hard marking scheme and often limited time to write exams. Night before final WEBCT discussion board postings went up like wild-fire! Everyone confused!
This guy should not be a prof. Not good at it. Do not take a course with him unless you want to ruin your GPA.

Really terrible! He takes this course way too seriously. The exams are marked unfairly since he's so stringent about what makes a good answer. He covers topic really fast and the lecture notes he puts online are incomplete so you get lost when studying and lectures are not taped so you're screwed. 1/4 of the class was failing after midterms...ETC

Mandatory to attend lectures in order to pass the course. Exams are difficult, and you are not allotted enough time to complete them. Spends time in lecture emphasizing certain topics/themes/concepts that are not present on exams.
Most boring ever

The structure is very hard to follow (lecture, readings). Teacher is poor at making things explicit and clear in his expectations. Overall, what was suppose to be a very interesting course ended up to be the least appeciated Psyc course at SFU. Although if you are able to grasp his intentions, then maybe you can do better than me.

If you do your readings before class like you are supposed to, this class will make sense and will be really interesting. If you don't do your readings and don't show up to class, of course you won't understand the class organization and you will get a poor grade. Dr. Read is a good prof, he's nice, and funny.
i enjoyed every bit of it. thanks u :)

Awesome class. Dr. Read definately knows his material well, and makes the course challenge, and informative. I would definately recommend this to anybody interested in the field. The man knows what he's talking about.

Do not take this class w/ read. Lecture notes put online after classes making things difficult. Extremely vague on paper instructions.  The whole organazation of the course was VERY poor. Rather dissapointing, cause the material can be quite interesting at times. Good subject, poor prof and t.a.'s.

he's got good intentions for getting the material across but flies by so fast there's no way to catch all that's important. he does not give any indication of what's more important so you feel you have to remember everything.

This is the first time this course was taught and it was not what I expected. Dr. Read made the course material really dry and I found him to be disorganized. Assignments NOT explained well and TA's marked them really hard. Would only recommend this course if it was taught by a different prof (which it is next semester)

Prof seems nice enough, but his course is REALLY unorganized.  Also, his instructions (eg. guidelines for the paper assignment) are really unclear.. His exams are hard and the papers are marked hard too...  Wouldn't recommend this course at all...

The material in this class is difficult, and the main reason that people don't do well is because they don't show up, not because Dr. Read is mean. If you show up, listen and do all the readings, you will learn and do well. The material is extremely interesting, and Dr. Read is super nice, very helpful, and very knowledgable about the material.
You know its a bad class when the T.A's are openly discussing how much they can't stand working for him! Enough said.

the 1st half of the course i hated....but towards to then i really enjoyed it....i failed the midterm but still got a B- so.....not too hard...2nd half of the course is easier if you're a psyc major...
No Comments
At least the TA's hot, whos with me?
the midterms are very difficult!

This professor is terrible,  I did well on the mid., but I thought it was difficult.  He is EXTREMELY disorganized, the 2nd midterm was re-scheduled 3 times. Did not know what readings were for 2nd mid. until it was the week before it, and it was not on the syllabus because it was revised 3 times,
I can remember what happened in R. v. Jones:) And of course there's legal material in the course ... it's called Law and Psychology! Awesome course, average instructor.
No Comments
If you take this class take a pillow...Only the Psych department would have a cognitive psychologist teaching a legally based course.
Material is interesting but 830 class is a killing. Exams focus too much on memorization. Who can remember what happened in R. vs. Jones.
